keyFactors.title: Expanding Usage Trend
keyFactors.description: Dowdle entered averaging 17.8 carries with expanding usage trends. Last 3 games showed 19.3 carries per game, indicating increased role in Carolina's offense.

keyFactors.title: Perfect Matchup
keyFactors.description: Saints allowed 24.1 carries per game to opposing RBs, ranking 28th in run defense. Vulnerable to volume RB performances.

keyFactors.title: Run-First Identity
keyFactors.description: Carolina's new OC emphasized run-first approach with backup QB Bryce Young limiting pass volume, creating ideal environment for 20+ RB attempts.

riskFactors: Backup QB Bryce Young's offensive limitations could stall drives
Saints' ball control could limit Carolina's total possessions
Potential negative game script if Panthers trail early

quarterBreakdown.description: Dowdle rushed for 5-yard TD on opening 67-yard drive. Strong start suggested volume would materialize. Received 5 early carries.
DISASTER. Carolina gained just 36 yards over next 5 first-half possessions. Young threw INT and fumbled on botched handoff. Offensive implosion began.
Trailing 17-7, Panthers managed season-low 175 total yards. Young completed 17-of-25 for 124 yards with 2 turnovers. Negative game script prevented Dowdle volume.

gameResults.whenMissed: Never cleared - stuck at 18 attempts, needed 2 more carries
gameResults.gamePace: Saints dominated time of possession. Carolina's offensive incompetence (83 first-half yards) forced abandonment of run game despite trailing by only 10 points.

whatWentWrong.title: Offensive Implosion
whatWentWrong.description: After opening drive TD, Carolina gained just 36 yards over next 5 first-half possessions. Young's 2 turnovers (INT, fumble) created catastrophic game flow.

whatWentWrong.title: Volume Prevented by Incompetence
whatWentWrong.description: Dowdle got 18 attempts with Carolina's offensive output was actually impressive given circumstances. The volume was there initially, but offensive execution killed drives.

whatWentWrong.title: Microscopic Miss
whatWentWrong.description: Needed only 2 more carries. The carry projection assumed competent offense maintaining competitive game script. Saints 17, Panthers 7 wasn't massive blowout, but Carolina couldn't sustain drives.

statisticalContext.percentileRanking: Bottom 40% of Dowdle's season performances for attempts

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: This was 75% bad luck, 25% analytical miss. The carry projection assumed competent offense maintaining competitive game script. Dowdle's 18 attempts with Carolina's offensive output was actually impressiveâ€”the volume was there initially, but catastrophic execution killed drives. closingLineValue.verdict: Slight positive CLV - line moved toward over as market recognized Dowdle's expanding role and favorable matchup.

keyTakeaways: Volume-based props require offensive competence floors - when Young generated 5.0 yards per attempt with 2 turnovers, no RB hits carry projections
The 2-carry miss stings but reflects game reality, not analytical failure
Carolina's season-low 175 total yards prevented Dowdle from reaching 20 attempts despite favorable matchup
Opening drive TD created false hope - offensive collapse after prevented volume materialization
Saints' ball control (time of possession dominance) limited total Carolina possessions
verdict: Right process, wrong outcome. Volume projection was sound given usage trends and matchup, but catastrophic offensive execution prevented volume materialization. Dowdle getting 18 attempts while Carolina scored 7 points actually shows strong RB usage - the offense just couldn't sustain drives.
